title: Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas put on an intimate display at JBL Fest event in Las Vegas
text:
They've become one of Hollywood's most well-known couples since they tied the knot in a lavish ceremony in Jodhpur, India last December.

And Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas looked more loved-up than ever as they attended the third annual JBL Fest at JEWEL nightclub in Las Vegas on Thursday.

The pair put on a cosy display on the orange carpet, gazing lovingly into each other's eyes as they shared a private joke.

Couple: Priyanka Chopra, 37, and Nick Jonas, 27, looked more loved-up than ever as they attended the third annual JBL Fest at JEWEL nightclub in Las Vegas on Thursday

Priyanka, 37, looked nothing short of sensational at the swanky event, donning a shimmering black strapless dress.

The garment featured a daring leg slit while the actress added height to her frame with a pair of matching heels.

Styling her raven tresses into lustrous waves, Priyanka completed her look for the evening with a black blazer.

Nick, 27, looked dapper for the occasion in a black denim jacket with a white rope-print detail while he also sported a pair of black jeans.

Donning matching boots, the Jonas Brothers singer finished his outfit with a white t-shirt.

Also in attendance at the event was Bebe Rexha who looked radiant in a skin-tight off the shoulder black dress.

The singer, 30, added height to her frame with a pair of eye-catching red leather boots and also wore gold hoop earrings.

Meanwhile, Vanderpump rules star Brittany Cartwright walked the orange carpet in an animal print dress while her co-star Ariana Madix donned a blue jumpsuit.

Nick and Priyanka tied the knot in a lavish extravaganza including Christian and Hindu ceremonies that took place over several days in the Indian city of Jodhpur.

In a recent interview on NBC's Today, the actress said she 'really can't wait' to have children with the Jonas Brother.

'I mean, there's so much that happens in our lives that whenever God blesses us with that it's something that we both definitely want,' she explained.

Priyanka told People back in March that while they were excited for children, it may not happen in the near future, due to their hectic schedules.

'We both know that that's something that needs to happen, but it's not something I think about very much,' she said regarding starting her family.

'We’re both very driven, we love our work, we’re married to our work, and we’re both very supportive of each other’s work. So I’m sure it will happen in an organic way.'

Priyanka confessed she has become a 'full groupie' for her husband's band The Jonas Brothers since they tied the knot.

While she was unfamiliar with the group before meeting her husband Nick Jonas, she had no trouble admitting her fandom to talk show host Jimmy Fallon.

'It's been so great. They're doing like 70 live shows in 3 months. I'm gonna get killed for this, but before I got married and started dating Nick, I didn’t know too much about the euphoria that is the Jonas Brothers. I’m a full groupie now,' she said.
description: The couple looked more loved-up than ever as they attended the third annual JBL Fest at Jewel nightclub in Las Vegas on Thursday.
